stations.name: Owings Mills
stations.description: Western terminus of the Metro SubwayLink. Surface station with approximately 3,500 parking spaces, the largest park-and-ride facility in the system.

stations.name: Old Court
stations.description: Surface station serving the Old Court Road area of Baltimore County. Opened as part of the 1987 Owings Mills extension.

stations.name: Milford Mill
stations.description: Surface station serving the Milford Mill area. The easternmost station added in the 1987 Owings Mills extension.

stations.name: Reisterstown Plaza
stations.description: Surface station adjacent to the Reisterstown Road Plaza shopping center. Original western terminus when the system opened in 1983.

stations.name: Rogers Avenue
stations.description: Surface station in the Park Heights neighborhood of northwest Baltimore.

stations.name: West Cold Spring
stations.description: Surface station near the intersection of Wabash Avenue and Cold Spring Lane in northwest Baltimore.

stations.name: Mondawmin
stations.description: Located near the Mondawmin Mall, this station marks the transition from surface running to the deep-bore tunnel section. Major bus transfer point.

stations.name: Penn North
stations.description: Deep underground station approximately 120 feet below street level, serving the Penn North neighborhood along Pennsylvania Avenue.

stations.name: Upton
stations.description: Underground station in the Upton neighborhood. Features Romare Bearden's jazz-themed mosaic artwork. Formerly known as Upton/Avenue Market.

stations.name: State Center
stations.description: Underground station near the Maryland State Center office complex. Walking distance to the Light RailLink Cultural Center stop for transfers.

stations.name: Lexington Market
stations.description: Underground station adjacent to the historic Lexington Market. Transfer point to the Light RailLink system via a short walk to the Lexington Market light rail stop on Howard Street.

stations.name: Charles Center
stations.description: Underground station in the heart of downtown Baltimore's Charles Center business district. Original eastern terminus when the system opened in 1983.

stations.name: Shot Tower
stations.description: Underground station near the historic Phoenix Shot Tower. Opened in 1995 as part of the Johns Hopkins extension. Formerly known as Shot Tower/Market Place.

stations.name: Johns Hopkins Hospital
stations.description: Eastern terminus of the Metro SubwayLink, serving the Johns Hopkins Hospital campus and East Baltimore. Opened in 1995, completing the 14-station line.
